parallel

Class OrderedBarrier

  • java.lang.Object
    • parallel.OrderedBarrier

  • public class OrderedBarrier
extends java.lang.Object

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    The class guarantees that if threads are synchronized via the OrderedBarrier class, any tasks given as args to the orderedBarrier(task) call, will execute in the order with which the threads executing them were first registered with the barrier (via the addThread(thread) call). Any such tasks must not be manipulated by other threads after they have been submitted for execution by the orderedBarrier(task) call. Behavior is undefined if after some threads have started using the orderedBarrier() call, another thread calls the addThread() method, unless a call to reset() is preceded at a time when all threads have finished waiting at their last barrier point.

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

    Company:

    • Method Detail

      • addThread

        public static void addThread(java.lang.Thread t)
        method must be called before orderedBarrier() can be used. It should be invoked only once by each thread which wishes to coordinate with the orderedBarrier() call.
        Parameters:
        t - Thread a thread that wishes to be coordinated in the order in which it registers with the OrderedBarrier class

      • addThread

        public static void addThread(java.lang.Thread t,
             java.lang.String barriername)
        method must be called before orderedBarrier() can be used. It should be invoked only once by each thread which wishes to coordinate with the orderedBarrier() call with the particular group provided by the barriername.
        Parameters:
        t - Thread a thread that wishes to be coordinated in the order in which it registers with the OrderedBarrier class

      • getInstance

        public static OrderedBarrier getInstance()
        return the unique OrderedBarrier instance that can exist in a JVM.
        Returns:
        OrderedBarrier

      • getInstance

        public static OrderedBarrier getInstance(java.lang.String name)
        returns the instance that was created by a prior call to OrderedBarrier.addThread(t,name)
        Parameters:
        name - String
        Returns:
        Barrier

      • removeInstance

        public static void removeInstance(java.lang.String name)
                           throws ParallelException
        remove the instance named after the argument passed in from the known data-base of Barrier instances (maintained by this class). The caller must ensure that no threads will call the barrier() method for the instance to be deleted again, otherwise deadlocks may arise (some threads waiting on the barrier, and the remaining threads will never be able to call the barrier() method again).
        Parameters:
        name - String
        Throws:
        ParallelException - if there was no such Barrier instance in the data-base of Barrier instances.

      • orderedBarrier

        public void orderedBarrier(TaskObject task)
                    throws ParallelException
        the main method to call when a barrier point must be erected. Each thread that must be co-ordinated, calls this method. Once all threads that have initially called the addThread() method reach this point, the task objects passed to the call are executed in the order with which the threads called the addThread() method.
        Parameters:
        task - TaskObject the task to execute in order
        Throws:
        ParallelException - if the thread calling the orderedBarrier(task) method has not been "registered" before with a call to addThread(thread) to this OrderedBarrier object.

      • reset

        public void reset()
           throws ParallelException
        the method resets the OrderedBarrier object. If any threads are still waiting on the barrier, the method throws ParallelException. The method's intent is to clean-up a used-up OrderedBarrier object so that it can be re-used later on (same or other threads calling first the addThread() method and then calling the orderedBarrier() method).
        Throws:
        ParallelException
